p-numeracy.text: Many students are concerned about their maths skills. How prepared do you feel in terms of mathematics and numeracy?

answers.info: Wonderful these will stand you  in good stead during your studies.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: These are skills that can be developed. We encourage you to attend an appropriate learning workshop. Details can be found on the [Academic Learning Centre website](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre). It is normal to be anxious about Maths.
answers.label: no

answers.info: These are skills that can be developed. We encourage you to attend an appropriate learning workshop. Details can be found on the [Academic Learning Centre website](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre). It is normal to be anxious about Maths.
answers.label: not sure

p-citations.text: Most of your assessment will need to be referenced in APA or Harvard format. Do you know where to find a guide on how to do that?

answers.info: Excellent.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: The library is a fantastic resource for referencing. There is a referencing guide available on the [Academic Learning Centre website](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre).
answers.label: no

uhiw-policies1.text: Are you confident that you understand the policies of the uni, e.g. Assessment of Course Work Policy, Withdrawal without Financial Penalty Policy?

answers.info: Wonderful, it is really important to have good awareness of these. CQU makes all of it policies available in [one place](https://www.cqu.edu.au/policy). However you will find several really important policies in your unit profile.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: You will find links to the relevant policies in course unit profile please make yourself familiar with them as they could be important.
answers.label: no

quizz-intro.text: Welcome to CQUniversity preparedness self-assement tool. We will lead you through some questions designed to help you get ready to study and let you know about the support services available to help you.

intro-end2.text: Would you like to skip to a particular section?

p-internet.text: Many units require you to download information. Do you have a reliable internet service?

answers.info: This is a really important aspect of your study, you will need to access your learning materials online - Moodle. So you may need to come to campus to access the online materials
answers.label: no

uhiw-policies2.text: Would you like to speak to someone about the university policies or processes?

answers.info: Send an email to this address,  student-advocacy@cqu.edu.au. Don't forget to include your phone number if you want them to call you.
answers.label: yes please

p-writingassessment.text: Many of your assessments at university are written; for example essays, reports and discussion papers based on research. Is this an area you are confident with?

answers.info: That's good to hear, let's move on.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: These are skills that can be developed. We encourage you to attend an appropriate workshop. Details can be found on the [Academic Learning Centre website](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre). It is normal to be anxious about writing your assessments.
answers.label: umm..

sa-intro.text: Nearly done, this is the last section.&&We want every student to succeed in their course so there are lots of supports available including personal support, career advice, financial support and academic support. &&Most students need to access these at one time or another. These questions will provide you some further information about these.

lb-cultural.text: Sometimes students tell us they have cultural obligations which impact on their attendance at compulsory course requirements such as residential schools/on-campus labs and /or availability for compulsory placements.&& Do you think this may be of concern to you at some stage?

answers.info: You may have a large extended family and be expected to participate in family events. Cultural responsibilities can be time consuming. You should talk about this with our counselling staff at counselling@cqu.edu.au
answers.label: yes

answers.info: Planning ahead of time is always the best approach to be sure that possible solutions are explored so that essential course requirements and other responsibilities can be met. You should talk about this with our counselling staff at counselling@cqu.edu.au
answers.label: maybe a bit

p-placements1.text: Does your course have Residential Schools, Placements, or Practicums?

answers.info: These are a wonderful experiences of work integrated learning. Make sure you familiarise yourself with dates of placements so that you can plan ahead.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: Unit profiles are available through **My Units** in MyCQU. Select the term and the unit you wish to view and then click unit profile to download your profile. If you are not currently enrolled go to [Planners and Profiles](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students/planners-and-profiles) and click on _click here_.
answers.label: no

sa-indigenous.text: We offer support for indigenous students. Want to know more?

answers.info: There are lots of supports for [Indigenous students](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/indigenous-support).
answers.label: yes

sa-counselling.text: If you need to talk to someone we have counsellors available face to face, by phone, or email or even SKYPE. Want to know more?

answers.info: Phone: 0749309456 or email counselling@cqu.edu.au
answers.label: yes

p-personalcontact.text: CQUniversity is using a more personalised approach to helping our students so you may have received a phone call from a mentor from your school. They are part of the Personalising the Student Experience team working to provide you with more support. Have you been contacted?

answers.info: Please let us know and we will ask someone to contact you. Contact one of the team on 1800 952 224 or sra@cqu.edu.au
answers.label: no

answers.info: Please let us know and we will ask someone to contact you. Contact one of the team on 1800 952 224 or sra@cqu.edu.au
answers.label: I don't think so

p-computerskills.text: You will use a range of computer skills at university such as email, creating documents and presentations,searching for information and keeping records of your work. How confident are you with your computer skills?

answers.info: Great, that will make your life much easier, however, there is support available should you require it. Check out the [Academic Learning Centre website](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre).
answers.label: Very

answers.info: If you find that you need to brush up on your skills there is plenty of support from the [Academic Learning Centre](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre)
answers.label: so so

answers.info: It is perfectly normal to be concerned about learning new technology for study. There is plenty of support, check out the [Academic Learning Centre](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre)
answers.label: not at all

lb-studyarea.text: Do you have a designated study area?

answers.info: Well done, study requires intense concentration so having a dedicated space to do this in is really wonderful. There are also excellent facilities on-campus that you are welcome to use. The helpdesk at the library can help you with this.
answers.label: I do

answers.info: Study requires intense concentration so having a dedicated space to do this in is really important. There are excellent facilities on-campus that you are welcome to use. The helpdesk at the library can help you with this.
answers.label: not yet

uhiw-keydates.text: There are a number of dates by which you need to have finalised enrolments, fees etc. They are shown in the Academic Calendar, are you aware of these?

answers.info: Please be aware of Census date. It is important to finalise your enrolment before census date so as you are not charged fees for units you do not wish to be enrolled in. Important dates can be found in the [Academic Calendar](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students/academic-calendars)
answers.label: yes

answers.info: Please be aware of Census date. It is important to finalise your enrolment before census date so as you are not charged fees for units you do not wish to be enrolled in. These important dates can be found in the [Academic Calendar](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students/academic-calendars)
answers.label: no

lb-travel.text: How far do you live from a campus location while you're studying?

answers.info: Attendance at lectures  is really important if you are studying internally. We do encourage students studying externally to check with your lecturer to see if possible for you to attend lectuers.
answers.label: Less than 30 mins

answers.info: In planning your studies you will need to think about managing your travel so that you can attend important and often compulsory requirements such as residential placements (schools), practicum and possibly on-campus labs (laboratories).
answers.label: Greater than 30 mins

p-unitprofiles.text: Do you know where to find Unit Profiles? These are provided by the lecturer in your units to provide you a guide to the unit.

answers.info: They are really important documents so make sure that you read them carefully.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: These are really important documents and you can find them on your learning management system Moodle. Go to MyCQU and each unit should have your details listed. If they are not indicated it could mean that they are not part of this unit. You could check this with your unit coordinator.
answers.label: no

answers.info: These are really important documents and you can find them on your learning management system Moodle. Go to MyCQU and each unit should have your details listed. If they are not indicated it could mean that they are not part of this unit. You could check this with your unit coordinator
answers.label: not sure

sa-bluecard.text: Some courses have requirements to get a Blue Card, immunisations, or a police check and these may take time to get. Have you checked your unit/units for requirments like this?

answers.info: If you need further assistance other than MyCQU please contact your academic liaison. Send an email to sra@cqu.edu.au or give them a call on 1800 952 224.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: If you need further assistance other than MyCQU please contact your academic liaison. Send an email to sra@cqu.edu.au or give them a call on 1800 952 224.
answers.label: no

uhiw-advice.text: Would you like some course advice?

answers.info: Send an email requesting course advice to this address, spc@cqu.edu.au. Don't forget to include your phone number if you want them to call you back.
answers.label: yes

sa-liaison.text: You have support from an Academic Liaison in your school. Want to find out more about this?

answers.info: You can get wonderful advice on all things course related. Send an email to sra@cqu.edu.au or give them a call on 1800 952 224.
answers.label: yep

lb-first.text: Are you the first in your family to go to uni?

answers.info: Congratulations we really welcome you to university. There are lots of supports available to help you, we will talk more about these later.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: You'll be able to talk to your family members about their university journey. Remember, every journey is different so there are lots of supports available as well. We will talk more about these later.
answers.label: no

p-alc.text: Did you know there is an Academic Learning Centre here to help you?

answers.info: The Academic Learning Centre is a wonderful place that helps you develop your skills as a learner through providing workshops, resources and individual consultations.  Check out their [website](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre).
answers.label: yes

answers.info: The Academic Learning Centre is a wonderful place that helps you develop your skills as a learner through providing workshops, resources and individual consultations.  Check out their [website](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre).
answers.label: no

sa-forms.text: Have your completed all your forms? These are completed online through the student portal. Check under MyCQU click on MyCentre and it will take you to some tiles one of which is forms - you should find both forms in here.

answers.info: You will be given reminders however you are able to check in your student portal. Check under MyCQU, click on MyCentre and it will take you to some tiles one of which is forms - you should find both forms in here.
answers.label: no

sa-orientation.text: Have you attended orientation or Orientation Online?

answers.info: Research shows that students who attend O week are well prepared for their study.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: O week is fantastic we encourage you to go to as many session as you can, check out the [schedule of events](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students/orientation). If you aren't able to make it or O week has already come and gone there are some online resources on the same website.
answers.label: no

sa-card.text: Have you applied for your student card? You will need it for exams. You can also get discounts at many businesses and for travel as a student.

answers.info: Hope you have a great photo.
answers.label: done

answers.info: The Student Assistance Centre can help you out with this. Here are the [instructions](https://www.cqu.edu.au/faqs?collection=cqu-sugar-kb&form=rest&query=%22How+do+I+get+a+student+ID+card%22).
answers.label: not yet

intro-end1.text: Is this your first time using this tool {studentname}?

answers.info: This shouldn't take more than 20 minutes of your time but you do need to be able to think about the topics raised and not be in a rush.&&We will make a list of contacts available for you to download at the end of the session.
answers.label: yes

lb-finances.text: Lots of students worry about finances during their studies. Are finances a concern for you?

answers.info: There are some options like scholarships or student loans or you may be eligible for Centrelink. Contact scholarships@cqu.edu.au for further information.
answers.label: yes

lb-studyload.text: How many units are you enrolled in this term?

answers.info: 3 units or more is a full-time load. A full-time study load is approximately 10 to 12 hours work per unit, per week. If you are working more than 20 hours per week we recommend a part-time study load.
answers.label: 3 or more

p-placements2.text: Do you know where to find out about them?

answers.info: Go to MyCQU and each unit should have your details listed. If they are not indicated it could mean that they are not part of this unit. You could check this with your unit coordinator.
answers.label: no

p-placements3.text: Have you considered that you may need to travel for a residential school or to do a placement/practicum?

answers.info: Don't forget to budget for travel, accommodation and other expenses. You can talk to your lecturer about this.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: For many students this requires them to take time off work so start organising this as soon as possible. Don't forget to budget for travel, accommodation and other expenses.
answers.label: no

studentname.text: What shall I call you during our chat?

sa-.text: Are you aware of anti bulling promoted at university?

answers.info: We are dedicated to creating a safe and supportive atmosphere for all students with a zero tolerance approach to bullying and discrimination. As part of this we promote acceptance and understanding for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, intersex and queer (LGBTIQ) students. You can find further information at [CQUniversity Respect.Now.Always](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students/student-support/health-and-welfare/respect-now-always)
answers.label: no

p-comms.text: In your studies you will be expected to produce written work and complete oral presentations. How confident do you feel with these?

answers.info: Brilliant! These skills will be a great help to you in your studies.
answers.label: very

answers.info: These are skills that can be developed. We encourage you to attend the appropriate learning workshop.  It is normal to be anxious about oral presentations. Details can be found on the [Academic Learning Centre website](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre).
answers.label: so so

answers.info: These are skills that can be developed. We encourage you to attend a learning workshop.  It is normal to be anxious about oral presentations.Details can be found on the [Academic Learning Centre website](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/academic-learning-centre).
answers.label: not at all

sa-scholarships.text: Did you know we offer many scholarships?

answers.info: Great, find out more about [them](https://www.cqu.edu.au/courses/scholarships)
answers.label: yes

answers.info: All the information can be found on our [scholarships web page]( https://www.cqu.edu.au/courses/scholarships)
answers.label: no

answers.info: Great, we welcome this, please send us an email email link here sra@cqu.edu.au.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: Bye
answers.label: no

p-studentportal.text: Are you comfortable using the Student Portal, MyCQU.

answers.info: That's good news, you will be using this constantly throughout your course. The  Student Assistance Team on 132786 can help you navigate this if any questions arise. Your Personalising the Student Experience staff may also assist you. Phone them on 1800 952 224.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: MyCQU is an integral part of your study so please login as soon as possible. You should have been sent login instructions. If you can't find your login details then please contact 132786.
answers.label: no

answers.info: The Student Assistance Team can help you navigate MyCQU if you are having problems finding your way around the system.
answers.label: I can login but ...

sa-career advice.text: Would you benefit from some career advice?

answers.info: That is a fantastic step to take, it can be difficult to decide on a career path. Please send us an email to careers@cqu.edu.au and we will contact you. Don't forget to include your phone number if you want us to call you.
answers.label: yes please

uhiw-intro.text: {studentname} you are now 3/4 of the way through.&&It can take a while to get your head around how all of the university systems work. These questions will help you identify what’s important and where to go if you need assistance.

lb-home.text: Do you have a support network who can assist you with your family responsibilities?

answers.info: Great, take advantage of all the support they can give you. You can find out more by phoning 132786 or 1800 952 224.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: The University has a fantastic mentoring program who can provide you with advice on what is available at uni to help you, make sure you sign up for that.
answers.label: no

uhiw-prestudy2.text: Are you applying (or would you like to apply) for Recognised Prior Learning for your previous study or work experience?

answers.info: Check out the [course calculator](https://mycredit.cqu.edu.au/) or speak to the Student Assistance Centre.
answers.label: yes

lb-intro.text: Sometimes students who commence the program tell us they find it difficult to achieve a study/work/family/life balance.&&This may include balancing full-time study with full- or part-time paid work, as well as with caring responsibilities.&&Is study/life balance a concern for you? Let's work through some examples.

sa-email.text: Do you want to know how to link your student email and personal email?

answers.info: Give the IT people a call on 1300 666 620 and they can assist you.
answers.label: that would be great

p-requirements.text: Inherent requirements are the fundamental abilities, attributes, skills and behaviours necessary to complete the learning outcomes of a course. Do you think you understand all the inherent requirements for your course?

answers.info: Wonderful. Inherent and Course Requirements make clear the expectations and requirements for your future study.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: Inherent and Course Requirements are important documents that make clear what is required to be successful in your course and for the work force. These are available via Moodle. We encourage you to become familiar with these documents. It is normal to be anxious about oral presentations.
answers.label: no

answers.info: Inherent and Course Requirements are important documents that make clear what is required to be successful in your course and for the work force. These are available via Moodle. We encourage you to become familiar with these documents. It is normal to be anxious about oral presentations.
answers.label: maybe not entirely

sa-textbooks.text: Have you found out what textbooks you need and where to buy them?

answers.info: Go and do this now. If you are buying second hand textbooks they are often posted on your Moodle forum, however do check that it is the correct edition, or speak to your lecturer in case there is only a small change in the later edition.
answers.label: no

uhiw-monitoring.text: Are you aware that the university monitors your academic progress. This is important because if you do happen to fail 50% of your units or the same unit twice you will be contacted by the university checking to see if everything is okay.

answers.info: This is a really important policy to be aware of. Find it on the [Monitoring Academic Progress page](https://www.cqu.edu.au/about-us/structure/governance/glossary/items/monitoring-academic-progress)
answers.label: yes

answers.info: This is a really important policy to be aware of. Find it on the [Monitoring Academic Progress page](https://www.cqu.edu.au/about-us/structure/governance/glossary/items/monitoring-academic-progress).
answers.label: no

p-enrol.text: Did you enrol before lectures started?

answers.info: Do you need some help to catch up? Contact your unit coordinator.
answers.label: no

sa-disability.text: Are you aware that disability support is available to you, even if your disability is only for a short while?

answers.info: This support is available for all forms of disability. Students can access this during times of stress, illness or accident. Find out more about the [services](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students/student-support/accessibility).
answers.label: yes

answers.info: This support is available for all forms of disability. Student can access this during times of stress, illness or accident. Find out more about how [CQU supports students with a disability](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students/student-support/accessibility)
answers.label: no

uhiw-prevstudy1.text: Have you studied  at university previously?

answers.info: Things might have changed since you last studied, we recommend that all students take advantage of the full range of support services. A link to support services is found under MyCQU, however you might like to check out the [New Students web page](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students)
answers.label: yes

answers.info: We recommend that all students take advantage of the full range of support services. Check out the [New Students page](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students).
answers.label: no

answers.info: If you are worried about your family responsibility impinging on your study you can access student well being staff. Counselling@cqu.edu.au
answers.label: yes

theend.text: Thanks for working through this, we hope it has helped you. [Here is a document that lists all of the contacts we've discussed and probably some more. ](Services available)

sa-tutor.text: You can also access tutoring online. Want to know more?

answers.info: You can find all the information you need at [Studiosity](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students/student-support/learning-support/studiosity)
answers.label: yes

p-intro.text: Nice work {studentname}, you've reached section 2 - Preparedness.&&Many students are worried about how prepared they are for university, this might relate to concerns about academic writing, numeracy, referencing etc. &&These questions will help you identify any concerns and let you know all of the support services on offer to help with them.

sa-mentor.text: Would you like info on the Mentor programme? This is where you are linked up with a fellow student that often has already completed the unit you are studying and are able to provide you with some guidance.

answers.info: All the information you need can be found on the [Student Mentors web page](https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/new-students/student-support/student-mentors).
answers.label: that would be terrific

answers.info: Students who connect with peers often perform better than those who don't but there are other ways of connecting such as engaging in tutorials or joining in with other activities around the uni.
answers.label: I'm OK thanks
